The task of sentiment analysis has wide applications, because most organizations collect large volumes of consumer feedback, which can be used to improve customer experience.

Sentiment classification is similar to lexicon based sentiment analysis in that both task require identifying the polarity of a subject. But, sentiment classification is different because in sentiment analysis the target is a noun or pronoun, as compared to a noun phrase in lexicon-based sentiment analysis.

Sentiment classification is done by training a classifier, which predicts a positive, negative or neutral classification. Positive classification of a document means the document has a positive sentiment towards the subject matter or entity. Negative means the document is expressing a negative sentiment, as opposed to positive.
